Hi <@U2H3TT8F2> Thanks for your note. You are right - it's no longer there. Seems like there is a lag (I had cleared my browser cache, etc., before but it still showed up). I'm now going to add the page back to see if the erroneous meta-data gets picked up again.

I just added the <http://www.zebrium.com/resources/video|www.zebrium.com/resources/video> page back into the sitemap. It now shows up again. But the same erroneous block is still there. Any idea how I get rid of that?

Not a problem, I believe the sitemap.xml file doesnt get updated instantly when you make changes and is on a scheduled interval when it updates (shouldnt be anymore than 2 hours max for those changes to happen). If you find it taking a longer time, please let me know.
ah ok, I am seeing it now

I may have misunderstood your plan of action. If you are using Content Staging, your only option is to push to the Primary Domain.  You can then update the Primary Domain to the new domain and that will make the switch automatically. The system will automatically create redirects for you.  If you create the pages outside of Content Staging and manually set the domain to one of the hs-sites domains on the page level, there is no way to change that domain in bulk.  That was the way I originally interpreted your question.  If you build in Content Staging, push to original domain, let it update, then replace primary with the new domain and leave the original domain redirecting to the new primary you will be fine.  A flexible URL mapping using the {rest-of-url} parameter will ensure the old pages are redirected to the new ones.
Any idea how I can get rid of the spurious meta-data. The videos and URLs that show up in sitemap.xml are not on that page at all (or in the template). I have no idea where they are coming from.
Let me take a look real quick and see what I can find.
Is that ok if I hop into your portal? (Just be looking around, wont be making any changes)
